case_title: Sardar Karim Hayat vs S. Ahmad Nawaz Shah
court: High Court of Judicature at Baghdad-ul-Jadid

facts.disputed_property: Dhanpat Mal Diwan Chand Factory, Sadiqabad
facts.issue: Possession and management rights over the factory
facts.initial_action: Magistrate issued notice under Section 145 Cr. P.C. and attached the factory
facts.respondent_claim: Apprehension of breach of peace due to possession dispute
facts.appellant_claim: Factory jointly possessed; appellant claims managing allottee rights

appellant: No apprehension of breach of peace existed
Joint possession invalidates Section 145 Cr. P.C.
Notice not published as required under Section 145(3) Cr. P.C.
Evacuee property cannot be attached under Section 12 of the Ordinance
respondent: Attachment under Section 145 Cr. P.C. is valid despite evacuee property exemption
Evacuee property laws do not apply to criminal court processes

preliminary_objection.issue: Validity of High Court under Section 50 of Bahawalpur Interim Constitution Act, 1952
preliminary_objection.decision: High Court is validly constituted under Section 50 and otherwise

revision_petition.decision: Attachment set aside due to evacuee property exemption under Section 12 of the Ordinance
reasoning: Evacuee property exempt from legal process including attachment
Notice improperly described the property and was not published
